body.name: Seagate IronWolf Pro 4TB NAS Internal Hard Drive HDD – CMR 3.5 Inch SATA 6Gb/s 7200 RPM 128MB Cache for RAID Network Attached Storage, Data Recovery Service – Frustration Free Packaging (ST4000NE001)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 8 hrs 24 mins.
features: IronWolf internal hard drives are the ideal solution for up to 24-bay, multi-user NAS server environments that demand powerhouse performance
Store more and work faster with a NAS hard drive that provides 4TB and speeds up to 214MB/s

Specifically built for less wear and tear, little to no noise/vibration, no lags or down time, increased file-sharing performance, lower power consumption, and extra data protection—even in the event of power loss
Easily monitor NAS drive health using the integrated IronWolf Health Management system, and enjoy long-term reliability with 1.2M hours MTBF
Five-year limited warranty and two-year Rescue Data Recovery Services included.Support for S.M.A.R.T. drive monitoring and reporting
body.description: The ideal solution for multi-user NAS enclosure environments, IronWolf Pro is perfect for teams needing to store more and work faster. Built for up to 24 bays and 4TB and speeds of up to 214MB/s, these internal hard drives are specifically built for less wear and tear, little to no noise/vibration, no lags or down time, increased file-sharing performance, lower power consumption. Easily monitor the health of hard drives using the integrated IronWolf Health Management system and enjoy long-term reliability with 1M hours MTBF and a five-year limited warranty that includes 2-year Rescue Data Recovery Services.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.7 4.7 out of 5 stars 125 ratings 4.7 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Be tough. Be ready. Optimized for NAS with AgileArray, IronWolf Pro enterprise-class hard drives are built to be always-on, always working in NAS enclosures with RAID up to 24 bays.

Home, SOHO, and SMB NAS AN SSD BUILT FOR NAS Optimized to run in network attached storage 24x7. DRIVE HEALTH MONITORING IronWolf Health Management automatically displays prevention, intervention, and recovery options. RETRIEVE DATA FASTER Available with spin speeds of 5900 RPM in lower capacities; with 7200 RPM in higher capacities. NAS-OPTIMIZED PERFORMANCE NAS-optimized with AgileArray firmware built on AcuTrac technology delivers vibration tolerance for multi-user environments.

Pick the right NAS drive Creative Pro, SMB Ideal for Home, SOHO Up to 24-bay NAS # of bays Up to 8-bay NAS 2TB to 16TB Capacity 1TB to 16TB 4TB to 16TB Health Management 4TB to 16TB 2 years included Data Recovery 4TB to 16TB Creative Pro, SMB Ideal for Large scale-outs — # of bays — 2TB to 16TB Capacity Up to 16TB 4TB to 16TB Health Management - 2 years included Data Recovery Optional

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Value for the price
reviews.reviewText: I'm very pleased with this purchase of IronWolf Internal Hard drives for my NAS All4Computers is easy to work with, accurate and prompt in shipment...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Products came as described. I opted for next day shipping and they arrived in perfect shape. Both devices were in a thick bubble wrap which protected the box from getting smashed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Working great so far
reviews.reviewText: I've been using Seagate 7200RPM hard drives since I first made the switch from IDE/ATAPI to SATA years ago. I've never yet had one fail. This one is replacing a 5 year old 1TB 7200 RPM Barracuda in my Linux server. Absolutely nothing wrong with that drive (in fact I'm giving it to a friend), I just needed more space. Since I'm using it in a server, and this drive is the exact same price as the 4TB Barracuda Pro, I decided on the NAS drive since it's better optimized for what I'm using the server for (mostly network storage). It was a breeze to set up once I figured out how to do GPT/UEFI under Linux (not difficult, I had just never done it before so needed to read some instructions first). Everything is working beautifully so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars MUCH CHEAPER THAN LAST YEAR
reviews.reviewText: THERE IS NOTHING TO DISLIKE. THE PRICE PER TB HAS DROPPED DRAMATICALLY. YOU CAN GET A 16TB DRIVE NOW, ENTERPRISE RATED, FOR LESS THAN $300.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good
reviews.reviewText: Replaced two1TB WD Black drives with this (they'd been running almost 24/7 for close to 9 years), only because I ran out of space on them in my HTPC. Working great, so far. Absolutely quiet. In fact, when I first installed it, I had to put my hand on it to verify it was even running, that's how quiet it is. Now, if it will last as long as the WD Black drives it replaced, I'll be a happy camper.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Drives - Noisy
reviews.reviewText: Not the best for a desktop or device near your workstation.I have a bunch of these in a NAS, they are quite noisy with the typical drive "clicking/grinding" sound when active.Silent when sitting idle of course.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for my NAS!
reviews.reviewText: Git two of these for my new NAS. They are working well. Price and storage size are the best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seamless Integration with Synology
reviews.reviewText: Purchased for a Synology DS218+. Plugged them in and forgot they were there. The software for tracking issues with failed sectors does a perfect handshake with the Synology NAS OS. You can see if a drive is close to failing.

I got the Seagate PRO's because they're the most reliable brand, they got the best warranty, and they can retrieve your data when it gets lost (hence the extra cost for the PRO version).I highly recommend getting the PRO version if you tend to use the harddrives for sensitive data, business, or such along those lines. You want something reliable, get this harddrive! Super easy to install.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 18, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: Fast access in a raid array
reviews.reviewText: Installed these drive towards the end of 2019 and working perfectly in my server. Media player and data access is perfect in the raid array but

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 12, 2019
